title: Black band artifact in PNG file generated by png.Encode
body:
by **jakans@earthlink.net**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. cd to pngbug directory, issue ./build command to build pngbug executable
2.run pngbug executable with default arguments (reads worldbyx.txt input file)
3. open default output file (borders.png) to see black band at bottom of PNG image

What is the expected output?

  map of country boundaries

What do you see instead?

  map of country boundaries with black artifact band at bottom

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?

  6g

Which operating system are you using?

  Mac OS 10.6.6

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)

  867d37fb41a4 tip

Please provide any additional information below.

pngbug -y 625 (cutting off top of world map) creates partial black band at bottom.  -y
600 leaves full artifact, -y 650 results in no band, changes to -r, -g, -b from default
127 eliminates band, as does -a of value other than default 255.  Could this be a bug in
PNG compression?
Attachments: 1. pngbug.zip (673242 bytes)
